result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:48 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for David Michael Nagel.  Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant David Michael Nagel in court. S/T Deputy N. Krueger. Atty Damrau direct. Deputy Krueger identifies DE. Atty Dolfi cross. Atty Damrau re-direct. Deputy Krueger dismissed. Atty argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Dolfi requests arraignment. Atty Damrau objection. Adjourned: 4:15 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 22SW285 executed on 8/21/2022. Search Warrant, Application and Affidavit signed by EFV on 8/21/2022. Filed in 22CF574. olg

The original document was titled: Report
The original history event date is: 08-22-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report, reviewed during INIT. bph

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random ETG testing at least THREE times per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:55 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Defendant for today. Defendant David Michael Nagel in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court will consider co-signature. Speedy prelim requested. Court sets Preliminary Hearing with Court Commissioner. Adjourned at 2:01 PM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
